subscriber.translation[0].definitions[0]: someone who pays money, usually once a year, to receive copies of a newspaper or magazine, or to have a service
subscriber.translation[0].definitions[1]: someone who pays money to be part of an organization or to help its work
subscriber.translation[1].definitions[0]: someone who pays money regularly in order to have a newspaper or magazine sent to them, or to receive telephone, television or Internet service
Country Music Television currently has 15 million subscribers.
We are longtime subscribers to your paper.
subscriber.translation[1].definitions[1]: someone who asks or agrees to buy shares in a company that is offering shares to the public
Financial forecasts should be disclosed to intending subscribers for shares in the company.
subscriber.translation[1].definitions[2]: someone who agrees to become one of the first members of a LIMITED COMPANY by signing the companyâ€™s MEMORANDUM OF ASSOCIATION
Subscribers to the memorandum must take at least one share each.
subscriber.translation[1].definitions[3]: a person, organization, or country that signs a document
Britain is not a subscriber to the convention.
